What I loved about the first one was it's rawness, it's artiness, it's intellect. No one, besides Bette maybe, was established and you're watching this group of gay friends find their way in life with all the drama in tow. Some storylines were risqué for the time, which made it all the more interesting. Cut to now and all of our beloved characters are well established, living these high flying lives that just seems so untrue to the characters that they were and it takes away a certain quality and relatability from them. We're now expected to find this in these new characters but the writing just doesn't quite live up to that same quirky standard. I understand this is a different show and perhaps they had to sell it that way to bring it back, perhaps they felt they needed a younger generation for a younger audience to relate to. It's not a bad show and the new characters aren't terrible, but there's a certain depth missing here. There was more to the L Word than affairs, it was about power dynamics, whilst at the same time being goofy and at times off the wall. GQ seems lost in a soap opera style drama and that comedic aspect seems absent. Which for an audience still deprived of real representation in the mainstream, might not seem that bad, but for others expecting more than this, you'll likely be disappointed.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":4263,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3,"contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2019-12-08","keywords":"lesbian","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000884/","name":"Jennifer Beals","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0595485/","name":"Katherine Moennig","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0354157/","name":"Leisha Hailey"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0052980/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1271093/","name":"Michele Abbott","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0149669/","name":"Ilene Chaiken","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1271884/","name":"Kathy Greenberg"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Season 2 Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3625959449","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmYzNGQzZjQtZGYxOS00OTRiLTg2ZDEtYzhhMmQzYzU5NjMzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmYzNGQzZjQtZGYxOS00OTRiLTg2ZDEtYzhhMmQzYzU5NjMzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Season 2 is available to stream August 6, 2021 on SHOWTIME."</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Profileri
programme.desc: Francuska serija pod nazivom "Profileri" predstavlja Chloé, kriminalističku psihologinju koja istražuje ubojice kako bi pomogla riješiti slučajeve zločina. Chloé Saint-Laurent je profiler i radi s policijskim timom za rješavanje ubojstva u Parizu. Ona je vrlo draga, nosi jako obojenu odjeću i veliku žutu torbu. Izgleda poput djevojčice koja treba lutku, ali je vrlo pametna i jako dobar profiler. Korak po korak, uklopit će se u tim a njezine kolege, u početku jako pridržane, postaju joj najbolji prijatelji.

programme.title: Testna vožnja
programme.desc: Vodimo vas u potragu za starim i novim automobilima i ljudima koji ih renoviraju. Auti koje ćemo vam predstaviti bit će testirani od strane vozača Formule 1, Mike Salona. Vodimo vas u potragu za starim i novim automobilima i ljudima koji ih renoviraju. Auti koje ćemo vam predstaviti bit će testirani od strane vozača Formule 1, Mike Salona. U svakoj epizodi Salon će nam reći nešto više o obnovljenim modelima.

There is a strong cast with great acting. programme.title: SEAL Team
Mornarički specijalci
programme.desc:
SEAL Team: Created by Benjamin Cavell. With David Boreanaz, Max Thieriot, Neil Brown Jr., A.J. Buckley. The lives of the elite Navy SEALs as they train, plan and execute the most dangerous, high-stakes missions the United States of America can ask." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt6473344/","name":"SEAL Team","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWQxMWI3ZmYtYjQzMC00M2MyLTliN2YtMzgyZTQ2OThhZWQ4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjg4NzAyOTA@._V1_.jpg","description":"The lives of the elite Navy SEALs as they train, plan and execute the most dangerous, high-stakes missions the United States of America can ask.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6473344/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"brentonh-31513"},"dateCreated":"2018-01-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"Persona non grata","reviewBody":"A term used in the series that could apply to a lot of the previously uneducated reviews found for this title already.

Let's get one thing straight - this show is intended for the military-inclined audience and/or military enthusiasts. I was never a SEAL, but rather a Pararescueman for the USAF who served two tours overseas; many of the "cheesy" interactions and "campy" dialogue alleged by non-military serving reviewers are very realistic. This is how we talk. We crack poor, inappropriate jokes at the worst times because laughter - regardless of the timing - is our only weapon against the crippling anxiety that comes with combat deployments, regardless of who you are. Most of us shield ourselves from our own thoughts, especially when it's quiet, and even our loved ones (including those we served with) through humor. That is how we act and this series portrays that sense of fear amicably from the perspective of a real soldier. We speak quickly, we use jargon, we live and breathe what we do at that level because of the years of dedication to the cause that it takes just to get to that point.

Second, this inane need to downvote the series based on a "female operator" is not only ridiculous - but inaccurate. She is not an operator like the rest of the men, clearly acknowledged in Episode 2 when she tells Clay (the strap) to sit in the back with "her" and the "rest of the support team". She works in a TOC, a 'Tactical Operation Command'; the TOC is our lifeline when we're out in the field. Often times, your commanding officer, a procurement officer (supply), relief team and general support staff (including special JTF attachments like OSI, ATF, JAG, etc.) are on standby and are communicating with other assets in the general vicinity to coordinate the mission as it progresses.

Third, the technical adviser for this show is far more capable of portraying our armed forces in a respectable fashion than the vast majority of other shows on television. I saw a lot of complaints about Episode 1's "boat scene" shootout; clearly you've never fired a weapon on a moving skiff in the dark to understand that you're firing for effect - to suppress. Sure, you hope to land the shot, but a bouncing, lightweight skiff on top of firing at a moving object from another moving object makes even the best shooters in the world miss shots; that's just practical application to a common sense scenario. The show handles some complex issues, and my only complaint thus far has been the HALO/HAHO jump (would have to re-watch to see which it was) without the proper altitude gear - a minor flaw, certainly not enough reason to "stop watching" in disgust. I've also seen a few comments about how "predictable" and "archetyped" the characters are - well, no shit. That's precisely the reason they've made it to such top-tier outfits; no loose cannon or quirky halfwit makes it to teams like these because there's no spot for someone who's unpredictable. I feel like all of the "unrealistic" comments come from those who have nerved served and don't understand the military as a whole besides some bullshit "news" report they see on television masquerading as fact.

To close out, learn to enjoy quality shows for what they are and stop believing you're forced to pick extreme scores to show how outraged you are by a show; if this is honestly so poor that it deserves a '1' and is the worst television show you've ever seen - I'd love to see what television you feel deserves a 7+.Don't be so over-dramatic, and moreover, stop judging what you don't understand.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":18818,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Drama","War"],"datePublished":"2017-09-27","keywords":"u.s. military,military,acronym in title,military uniform,nco","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004770/","name":"David Boreanaz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1302735/","name":"Max Thieriot"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0112932/","name":"Neil Brown Jr."}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0666604/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0665583/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0280908/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3859706/","name":"Benjamin Cavell"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"First Look","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3313809689","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzNhOTQzM2YtZjc1ZC00ODExLTgzODAtNmQyNDI1MjhiMjg3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzNhOTQzM2YtZjc1ZC00ODExLTgzODAtNmQyNDI1MjhiMjg3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Follow the lives of the most elite unit of Navy SEALs as they train, plan and execute the most dangerous missions our country can ask of them."}}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: SEAL Team
Mornarički specijalci
programme.desc:
SEAL Team: Created by Benjamin Cavell. With David Boreanaz, Max Thieriot, Neil Brown Jr., A.J. Buckley. The lives of the elite Navy SEALs as they train, plan and execute the most dangerous, high-stakes missions the United States of America can ask." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt6473344/","name":"SEAL Team","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWQxMWI3ZmYtYjQzMC00M2MyLTliN2YtMzgyZTQ2OThhZWQ4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjg4NzAyOTA@._V1_.jpg","description":"The lives of the elite Navy SEALs as they train, plan and execute the most dangerous, high-stakes missions the United States of America can ask.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6473344/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"brentonh-31513"},"dateCreated":"2018-01-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"Persona non grata","reviewBody":"A term used in the series that could apply to a lot of the previously uneducated reviews found for this title already.

Let's get one thing straight - this show is intended for the military-inclined audience and/or military enthusiasts. I was never a SEAL, but rather a Pararescueman for the USAF who served two tours overseas; many of the "cheesy" interactions and "campy" dialogue alleged by non-military serving reviewers are very realistic. This is how we talk. We crack poor, inappropriate jokes at the worst times because laughter - regardless of the timing - is our only weapon against the crippling anxiety that comes with combat deployments, regardless of who you are. Most of us shield ourselves from our own thoughts, especially when it's quiet, and even our loved ones (including those we served with) through humor. That is how we act and this series portrays that sense of fear amicably from the perspective of a real soldier. We speak quickly, we use jargon, we live and breathe what we do at that level because of the years of dedication to the cause that it takes just to get to that point.

Second, this inane need to downvote the series based on a "female operator" is not only ridiculous - but inaccurate. She is not an operator like the rest of the men, clearly acknowledged in Episode 2 when she tells Clay (the strap) to sit in the back with "her" and the "rest of the support team". She works in a TOC, a 'Tactical Operation Command'; the TOC is our lifeline when we're out in the field. Often times, your commanding officer, a procurement officer (supply), relief team and general support staff (including special JTF attachments like OSI, ATF, JAG, etc.) are on standby and are communicating with other assets in the general vicinity to coordinate the mission as it progresses.

Third, the technical adviser for this show is far more capable of portraying our armed forces in a respectable fashion than the vast majority of other shows on television. I saw a lot of complaints about Episode 1's "boat scene" shootout; clearly you've never fired a weapon on a moving skiff in the dark to understand that you're firing for effect - to suppress. Sure, you hope to land the shot, but a bouncing, lightweight skiff on top of firing at a moving object from another moving object makes even the best shooters in the world miss shots; that's just practical application to a common sense scenario. The show handles some complex issues, and my only complaint thus far has been the HALO/HAHO jump (would have to re-watch to see which it was) without the proper altitude gear - a minor flaw, certainly not enough reason to "stop watching" in disgust. I've also seen a few comments about how "predictable" and "archetyped" the characters are - well, no shit. That's precisely the reason they've made it to such top-tier outfits; no loose cannon or quirky halfwit makes it to teams like these because there's no spot for someone who's unpredictable. I feel like all of the "unrealistic" comments come from those who have nerved served and don't understand the military as a whole besides some bullshit "news" report they see on television masquerading as fact.

To close out, learn to enjoy quality shows for what they are and stop believing you're forced to pick extreme scores to show how outraged you are by a show; if this is honestly so poor that it deserves a '1' and is the worst television show you've ever seen - I'd love to see what television you feel deserves a 7+.Don't be so over-dramatic, and moreover, stop judging what you don't understand.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":18818,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Drama","War"],"datePublished":"2017-09-27","keywords":"u.s. military,military,acronym in title,military uniform,nco","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004770/","name":"David Boreanaz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1302735/","name":"Max Thieriot"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0112932/","name":"Neil Brown Jr."}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0666604/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0665583/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0280908/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3859706/","name":"Benjamin Cavell"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"First Look","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3313809689","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzNhOTQzM2YtZjc1ZC00ODExLTgzODAtNmQyNDI1MjhiMjg3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzNhOTQzM2YtZjc1ZC00ODExLTgzODAtNmQyNDI1MjhiMjg3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Follow the lives of the most elite unit of Navy SEALs as they train, plan and execute the most dangerous missions our country can ask of them."}}</script><metacontent="

https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWQxMWI3ZmYtYjQzMC00M2MyLTliN2YtMzgyZTQ2OThhZWQ4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjg4NzAyOTA@._V1_QL75_UX190_CR0,2,190,281_.jpg

programme.title: SEAL Team
Mornarički specijalci
programme.desc:
SEAL Team: Created by Benjamin Cavell. With David Boreanaz, Max Thieriot, Neil Brown Jr., A.J. Buckley. The lives of the elite Navy SEALs as they train, plan and execute the most dangerous, high-stakes missions the United States of America can ask." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt6473344/","name":"SEAL Team","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWQxMWI3ZmYtYjQzMC00M2MyLTliN2YtMzgyZTQ2OThhZWQ4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjg4NzAyOTA@._V1_.jpg","description":"The lives of the elite Navy SEALs as they train, plan and execute the most dangerous, high-stakes missions the United States of America can ask.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6473344/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"brentonh-31513"},"dateCreated":"2018-01-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"Persona non grata","reviewBody":"A term used in the series that could apply to a lot of the previously uneducated reviews found for this title already.

Let's get one thing straight - this show is intended for the military-inclined audience and/or military enthusiasts. I was never a SEAL, but rather a Pararescueman for the USAF who served two tours overseas; many of the "cheesy" interactions and "campy" dialogue alleged by non-military serving reviewers are very realistic. This is how we talk. We crack poor, inappropriate jokes at the worst times because laughter - regardless of the timing - is our only weapon against the crippling anxiety that comes with combat deployments, regardless of who you are. Most of us shield ourselves from our own thoughts, especially when it's quiet, and even our loved ones (including those we served with) through humor. That is how we act and this series portrays that sense of fear amicably from the perspective of a real soldier. We speak quickly, we use jargon, we live and breathe what we do at that level because of the years of dedication to the cause that it takes just to get to that point.

Second, this inane need to downvote the series based on a "female operator" is not only ridiculous - but inaccurate. She is not an operator like the rest of the men, clearly acknowledged in Episode 2 when she tells Clay (the strap) to sit in the back with "her" and the "rest of the support team". She works in a TOC, a 'Tactical Operation Command'; the TOC is our lifeline when we're out in the field. Often times, your commanding officer, a procurement officer (supply), relief team and general support staff (including special JTF attachments like OSI, ATF, JAG, etc.) are on standby and are communicating with other assets in the general vicinity to coordinate the mission as it progresses.

Third, the technical adviser for this show is far more capable of portraying our armed forces in a respectable fashion than the vast majority of other shows on television. I saw a lot of complaints about Episode 1's "boat scene" shootout; clearly you've never fired a weapon on a moving skiff in the dark to understand that you're firing for effect - to suppress. Sure, you hope to land the shot, but a bouncing, lightweight skiff on top of firing at a moving object from another moving object makes even the best shooters in the world miss shots; that's just practical application to a common sense scenario. The show handles some complex issues, and my only complaint thus far has been the HALO/HAHO jump (would have to re-watch to see which it was) without the proper altitude gear - a minor flaw, certainly not enough reason to "stop watching" in disgust. I've also seen a few comments about how "predictable" and "archetyped" the characters are - well, no shit. That's precisely the reason they've made it to such top-tier outfits; no loose cannon or quirky halfwit makes it to teams like these because there's no spot for someone who's unpredictable. I feel like all of the "unrealistic" comments come from those who have nerved served and don't understand the military as a whole besides some bullshit "news" report they see on television masquerading as fact.

To close out, learn to enjoy quality shows for what they are and stop believing you're forced to pick extreme scores to show how outraged you are by a show; if this is honestly so poor that it deserves a '1' and is the worst television show you've ever seen - I'd love to see what television you feel deserves a 7+.Don't be so over-dramatic, and moreover, stop judging what you don't understand.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":18818,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Drama","War"],"datePublished":"2017-09-27","keywords":"u.s. military,military,acronym in title,military uniform,nco","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004770/","name":"David Boreanaz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1302735/","name":"Max Thieriot"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0112932/","name":"Neil Brown Jr."}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0666604/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0665583/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0280908/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3859706/","name":"Benjamin Cavell"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"First Look","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3313809689","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzNhOTQzM2YtZjc1ZC00ODExLTgzODAtNmQyNDI1MjhiMjg3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzNhOTQzM2YtZjc1ZC00ODExLTgzODAtNmQyNDI1MjhiMjg3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Follow the lives of the most elite unit of Navy SEALs as they train, plan and execute the most dangerous missions our country can ask of them."}}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The L Word: Generation Q
Ljubav za ljubav
programme.desc: The L Word: Generation Q: Created by Michele Abbott, Ilene Chaiken, Kathy Greenberg, Marja-Lewis Ryan. With Jennifer Beals, Katherine Moennig, Leisha Hailey, Arienne Mandi. Bette Porter, Shane McCutcheon, and Alice Pieszecki intermingle with a younger generation of Los Angelenos experiencing love, heartbreak, sex, setbacks, and success." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt7661384/","name":"The L Word: Generation Q","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWY2ZTE4NzAtMzgyOC00NmY4LTlhZDktZGRhYTNlNzFlODliXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyOTA3MTMyOTk@._V1_.jpg","description":"Bette Porter, Shane McCutcheon, and Alice Pieszecki intermingle with a younger generation of Los Angelenos experiencing love, heartbreak, sex, setbacks, and success.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7661384/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"umwotulookin"},"dateCreated":"2021-08-18","inLanguage":"English","name":"L is for lost","reviewBody":"I'm biased in writing this since I'm comparing the original but one can't help do that when some of the same cast members are in this one. What I loved about the first one was it's rawness, it's artiness, it's intellect. No one, besides Bette maybe, was established and you're watching this group of gay friends find their way in life with all the drama in tow. Some storylines were risqué for the time, which made it all the more interesting. Cut to now and all of our beloved characters are well established, living these high flying lives that just seems so untrue to the characters that they were and it takes away a certain quality and relatability from them. We're now expected to find this in these new characters but the writing just doesn't quite live up to that same quirky standard. I understand this is a different show and perhaps they had to sell it that way to bring it back, perhaps they felt they needed a younger generation for a younger audience to relate to. It's not a bad show and the new characters aren't terrible, but there's a certain depth missing here. There was more to the L Word than affairs, it was about power dynamics, whilst at the same time being goofy and at times off the wall. GQ seems lost in a soap opera style drama and that comedic aspect seems absent. Which for an audience still deprived of real representation in the mainstream, might not seem that bad, but for others expecting more than this, you'll likely be disappointed.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":4263,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3},"contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2019-12-08","keywords":"lesbian","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000884/","name":"Jennifer Beals"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0595485/","name":"Katherine Moennig"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0354157/","name":"Leisha Hailey"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0052980/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1271093/","name":"Michele Abbott"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0149669/","name":"Ilene Chaiken"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1271884/","name":"Kathy Greenberg"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Season 2 Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3625959449","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmYzNGQzZjQtZGYxOS00OTRiLTg2ZDEtYzhhMmQzYzU5NjMzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmYzNGQzZjQtZGYxOS00OTRiLTg2ZDEtYzhhMmQzYzU5NjMzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Season 2 is available to stream August 6, 2021 on SHOWTIME."}}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Tuđinka
programme.desc: Claire Randall, udana medicinska sestra koja radi u vojsci 1945. godine, vrati se kroz vrijeme na misteriozan način u 1743., u neki čudan svijet u kojem joj je život u opasnosti. Claire Randall, udana medicinska sestra koja radi u vojsci 1945. godine, vrati se kroz vrijeme na misteriozan način u 1743., u neki čudan svijet u kojem joj je život u opasnosti. Kada je primorana da se uda za Jamiea, kavalira i romantičnog škotskog ratnika, počinje se razbuktavati strast koja lomi Claireino srce između dva potpuno različita čovjeka i dva potpuno različita života.

programme.title: Profileri
programme.desc: Francuska serija pod nazivom "Profileri" predstavlja Chloé, kriminalističku psihologinju koja istražuje ubojice kako bi pomogla riješiti slučajeve zločina. Chloé Saint-Laurent je profiler i radi s policijskim timom za rješavanje ubojstva u Parizu. Ona je vrlo draga, nosi jako obojenu odjeću i veliku žutu torbu. Izgleda poput djevojčice koja treba lutku, ali je vrlo pametna i jako dobar profiler. Korak po korak, uklopit će se u tim a njezine kolege, u početku jako pridržane, postaju joj najbolji prijatelji.

programme.title: Profileri
programme.desc: Francuska serija pod nazivom "Profileri" predstavlja Chloé, kriminalističku psihologinju koja istražuje ubojice kako bi pomogla riješiti slučajeve zločina. Chloé Saint-Laurent je profiler i radi s policijskim timom za rješavanje ubojstva u Parizu. Ona je vrlo draga, nosi jako obojenu odjeću i veliku žutu torbu. Izgleda poput djevojčice koja treba lutku, ali je vrlo pametna i jako dobar profiler. Korak po korak, uklopit će se u tim a njezine kolege, u početku jako pridržane, postaju joj najbolji prijatelji.

programme.title: SEAL Team
Mornarički specijalci
programme.desc:
SEAL Team: Created by Benjamin Cavell. With David Boreanaz, Max Thieriot, Neil Brown Jr., A.J. Buckley. The lives of the elite Navy SEALs as they train, plan and execute the most dangerous, high-stakes missions the United States of America can ask." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt6473344/","name":"SEAL Team","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWQxMWI3ZmYtYjQzMC00M2MyLTliN2YtMzgyZTQ2OThhZWQ4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjg4NzAyOTA@._V1_.jpg","description":"The lives of the elite Navy SEALs as they train, plan and execute the most dangerous, high-stakes missions the United States of America can ask.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6473344/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"brentonh-31513"},"dateCreated":"2018-01-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"Persona non grata","reviewBody":"A term used in the series that could apply to a lot of the previously uneducated reviews found for this title already.

Let's get one thing straight - this show is intended for the military-inclined audience and/or military enthusiasts. I was never a SEAL, but rather a Pararescueman for the USAF who served two tours overseas; many of the "cheesy" interactions and "campy" dialogue alleged by non-military serving reviewers are very realistic. This is how we talk. We crack poor, inappropriate jokes at the worst times because laughter - regardless of the timing - is our only weapon against the crippling anxiety that comes with combat deployments, regardless of who you are. Most of us shield ourselves from our own thoughts, especially when it's quiet, and even our loved ones (including those we served with) through humor. That is how we act and this series portrays that sense of fear amicably from the perspective of a real soldier. We speak quickly, we use jargon, we live and breathe what we do at that level because of the years of dedication to the cause that it takes just to get to that point.

Second, this inane need to downvote the series based on a "female operator" is not only ridiculous - but inaccurate. She is not an operator like the rest of the men, clearly acknowledged in Episode 2 when she tells Clay (the strap) to sit in the back with "her" and the "rest of the support team". She works in a TOC, a 'Tactical Operation Command'; the TOC is our lifeline when we're out in the field. Often times, your commanding officer, a procurement officer (supply), relief team and general support staff (including special JTF attachments like OSI, ATF, JAG, etc.) are on standby and are communicating with other assets in the general vicinity to coordinate the mission as it progresses.

Third, the technical adviser for this show is far more capable of portraying our armed forces in a respectable fashion than the vast majority of other shows on television. I saw a lot of complaints about Episode 1's "boat scene" shootout; clearly you've never fired a weapon on a moving skiff in the dark to understand that you're firing for effect - to suppress. Sure, you hope to land the shot, but a bouncing, lightweight skiff on top of firing at a moving object from another moving object makes even the best shooters in the world miss shots; that's just practical application to a common sense scenario. The show handles some complex issues, and my only complaint thus far has been the HALO/HAHO jump (would have to re-watch to see which it was) without the proper altitude gear - a minor flaw, certainly not enough reason to "stop watching" in disgust. I've also seen a few comments about how "predictable" and "archetyped" the characters are - well, no shit. That's precisely the reason they've made it to such top-tier outfits; no loose cannon or quirky halfwit makes it to teams like these because there's no spot for someone who's unpredictable. I feel like all of the "unrealistic" comments come from those who have nerved served and don't understand the military as a whole besides some bullshit "news" report they see on television masquerading as fact.

To close out, learn to enjoy quality shows for what they are and stop believing you're forced to pick extreme scores to show how outraged you are by a show; if this is honestly so poor that it deserves a '1' and is the worst television show you've ever seen - I'd love to see what television you feel deserves a 7+.Don't be so over-dramatic, and moreover, stop judging what you don't understand.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":18818,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Drama","War"],"datePublished":"2017-09-27","keywords":"u.s. military,military,acronym in title,military uniform,nco","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004770/","name":"David Boreanaz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1302735/","name":"Max Thieriot"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0112932/","name":"Neil Brown Jr."}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0666604/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0665583/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0280908/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3859706/","name":"Benjamin Cavell"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"First Look","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3313809689","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzNhOTQzM2YtZjc1ZC00ODExLTgzODAtNmQyNDI1MjhiMjg3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzNhOTQzM2YtZjc1ZC00ODExLTgzODAtNmQyNDI1MjhiMjg3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Follow the lives of the most elite unit of Navy SEALs as they train, plan and execute the most dangerous missions our country can ask of them."}}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: SEAL Team
Mornarički specijalci
programme.desc:
SEAL Team: Created by Benjamin Cavell. With David Boreanaz, Max Thieriot, Neil Brown Jr., A.J. Buckley. The lives of the elite Navy SEALs as they train, plan and execute the most dangerous, high-stakes missions the United States of America can ask." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt6473344/","name":"SEAL Team","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWQxMWI3ZmYtYjQzMC00M2MyLTliN2YtMzgyZTQ2OThhZWQ4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjg4NzAyOTA@._V1_.jpg","description":"The lives of the elite Navy SEALs as they train, plan and execute the most dangerous, high-stakes missions the United States of America can ask.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6473344/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"brentonh-31513"},"dateCreated":"2018-01-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"Persona non grata","reviewBody":"A term used in the series that could apply to a lot of the previously uneducated reviews found for this title already.

Let's get one thing straight - this show is intended for the military-inclined audience and/or military enthusiasts. I was never a SEAL, but rather a Pararescueman for the USAF who served two tours overseas; many of the "cheesy" interactions and "campy" dialogue alleged by non-military serving reviewers are very realistic. This is how we talk. We crack poor, inappropriate jokes at the worst times because laughter - regardless of the timing - is our only weapon against the crippling anxiety that comes with combat deployments, regardless of who you are. Most of us shield ourselves from our own thoughts, especially when it's quiet, and even our loved ones (including those we served with) through humor. That is how we act and this series portrays that sense of fear amicably from the perspective of a real soldier. We speak quickly, we use jargon, we live and breathe what we do at that level because of the years of dedication to the cause that it takes just to get to that point.

Second, this inane need to downvote the series based on a "female operator" is not only ridiculous - but inaccurate. She is not an operator like the rest of the men, clearly acknowledged in Episode 2 when she tells Clay (the strap) to sit in the back with "her" and the "rest of the support team". She works in a TOC, a 'Tactical Operation Command'; the TOC is our lifeline when we're out in the field. Often times, your commanding officer, a procurement officer (supply), relief team and general support staff (including special JTF attachments like OSI, ATF, JAG, etc.) are on standby and are communicating with other assets in the general vicinity to coordinate the mission as it progresses.

Third, the technical adviser for this show is far more capable of portraying our armed forces in a respectable fashion than the vast majority of other shows on television. I saw a lot of complaints about Episode 1's "boat scene" shootout; clearly you've never fired a weapon on a moving skiff in the dark to understand that you're firing for effect - to suppress. Sure, you hope to land the shot, but a bouncing, lightweight skiff on top of firing at a moving object from another moving object makes even the best shooters in the world miss shots; that's just practical application to a common sense scenario. The show handles some complex issues, and my only complaint thus far has been the HALO/HAHO jump (would have to re-watch to see which it was) without the proper altitude gear - a minor flaw, certainly not enough reason to "stop watching" in disgust. I've also seen a few comments about how "predictable" and "archetyped" the characters are - well, no shit. That's precisely the reason they've made it to such top-tier outfits; no loose cannon or quirky halfwit makes it to teams like these because there's no spot for someone who's unpredictable. I feel like all of the "unrealistic" comments come from those who have nerved served and don't understand the military as a whole besides some bullshit "news" report they see on television masquerading as fact.

To close out, learn to enjoy quality shows for what they are and stop believing you're forced to pick extreme scores to show how outraged you are by a show; if this is honestly so poor that it deserves a '1' and is the worst television show you've ever seen - I'd love to see what television you feel deserves a 7+.Don't be so over-dramatic, and moreover, stop judging what you don't understand.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":18818,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Drama","War"],"datePublished":"2017-09-27","keywords":"u.s. military,military,acronym in title,military uniform,nco","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004770/","name":"David Boreanaz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1302735/","name":"Max Thieriot"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0112932/","name":"Neil Brown Jr."}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0666604/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0665583/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0280908/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3859706/","name":"Benjamin Cavell"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"First Look","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3313809689","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzNhOTQzM2YtZjc1ZC00ODExLTgzODAtNmQyNDI1MjhiMjg3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzNhOTQzM2YtZjc1ZC00ODExLTgzODAtNmQyNDI1MjhiMjg3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Follow the lives of the most elite unit of Navy SEALs as they train, plan and execute the most dangerous missions our country can ask of them."}}</script><metacontent="

That's precisely the reason they've made it to such top-tier outfits; no loose cannon or quirky halfwit makes it to teams like these because there's no spot for someone who's unpredictable. I feel like all of the "unrealistic" comments come from those who have nerved served and don't understand the military as a whole besides some bullshit "news" report they see on television masquerading as fact.

To close out, learn to enjoy quality shows for what they are and stop believing you're forced to pick extreme scores to show how outraged you are by a show; if this is honestly so poor that it deserves a '1' and is the worst television show you've ever seen - I'd love to see what television you feel deserves a 7+.Don't be so over-dramatic, and moreover, stop judging what you don't understand.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":18818,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Drama","War"],"datePublished":"2017-09-27","keywords":"u.s. military,military,acronym in title,military uniform,nco","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004770/","name":"David Boreanaz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1302735/","name":"Max Thieriot"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0112932/","name":"Neil Brown Jr."}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0666604/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0665583/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0280908/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3859706/","name":"Benjamin Cavell"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"First Look","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3313809689","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzNhOTQzM2YtZjc1ZC00ODExLTgzODAtNmQyNDI1MjhiMjg3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzNhOTQzM2YtZjc1ZC00ODExLTgzODAtNmQyNDI1MjhiMjg3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Follow the lives of the most elite unit of Navy SEALs as they train, plan and execute the most dangerous missions our country can ask of them."}}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 6473344, Title: SEAL Team, --- Description: SEAL Team: Created by Benjamin Cavell. With David Boreanaz, Max Thieriot, Neil Brown Jr., A.J. Buckley. The lives of the elite Navy SEALs as they train, plan and execute the most dangerous, high-stakes missions the United States of America can ask." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt6473344/","name":"SEAL Team","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWQxMWI3ZmYtYjQzMC00M2MyLTliN2YtMzgyZTQ2OThhZWQ4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjg4NzAyOTA@._V1_.jpg","description":"The lives of the elite Navy SEALs as they train, plan and execute the most dangerous, high-stakes missions the United States of America can ask.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6473344/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"brentonh-31513","dateCreated":"2018-01-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"Persona non grata","reviewBody":"A term used in the series that could apply to a lot of the previously uneducated reviews found for this title already.

Let's get one thing straight - this show is intended for the military-inclined audience and/or military enthusiasts. I was never a SEAL, but rather a Pararescueman for the USAF who served two tours overseas; many of the "cheesy" interactions and "campy" dialogue alleged by non-military serving reviewers are very realistic. This is how we talk. We crack poor, inappropriate jokes at the worst times because laughter - regardless of the timing - is our only weapon against the crippling anxiety that comes with combat deployments, regardless of who you are. Most of us shield ourselves from our own thoughts, especially when it's quiet, and even our loved ones (including those we served with) through humor. That is how we act and this series portrays that sense of fear amicably from the perspective of a real soldier. We speak quickly, we use jargon, we live and breathe what we do at that level because of the years of dedication to the cause that it takes just to get to that point.

Second, this inane need to downvote the series based on a "female operator" is not only ridiculous - but inaccurate. She is not an operator like the rest of the men, clearly acknowledged in Episode 2 when she tells Clay (the strap) to sit in the back with "her" and the "rest of the support team". She works in a TOC, a 'Tactical Operation Command'; the TOC is our lifeline when we're out in the field. Often times, your commanding officer, a procurement officer (supply), relief team and general support staff (including special JTF attachments like OSI, ATF, JAG, etc.) are on standby and are communicating with other assets in the general vicinity to coordinate the mission as it progresses.

Third, the technical adviser for this show is far more capable of portraying our armed forces in a respectable fashion than the vast majority of other shows on television. I saw a lot of complaints about Episode 1's "boat scene" shootout; clearly you've never fired a weapon on a moving skiff in the dark to understand that you're firing for effect - to suppress. Sure, you hope to land the shot, but a bouncing, lightweight skiff on top of firing at a moving object from another moving object makes even the best shooters in the world miss shots; that's just practical application to a common sense scenario. The show handles some complex issues, and my only complaint thus far has been the HALO/HAHO jump (would have to re-watch to see which it was) without the proper altitude gear - a minor flaw, certainly not enough reason to "stop watching" in disgust. I've also seen a few comments about how "predictable" and "archetyped" the characters are - well, no shit. That's precisely the reason they've made it to such top-tier outfits; no loose cannon or quirky halfwit makes it to teams like these because there's no spot for someone who's unpredictable. I feel like all of the "unrealistic" comments come from those who have nerved served and don't understand the military as a whole besides some bullshit "news" report they see on television masquerading as fact.

To close out, learn to enjoy quality shows for what they are and stop believing you're forced to pick extreme scores to show how outraged you are by a show; if this is honestly so poor that it deserves a '1' and is the worst television show you've ever seen - I'd love to see what television you feel deserves a 7+.Don't be so over-dramatic, and moreover, stop judging what you don't understand.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":18818,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Drama","War"],"datePublished":"2017-09-27","keywords":"u.s. military,military,acronym in title,military uniform,nco","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004770/","name":"David Boreanaz","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1302735/","name":"Max Thieriot","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0112932/","name":"Neil Brown Jr."],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0666604/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0665583/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0280908/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3859706/","name":"Benjamin Cavell"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"First Look","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3313809689","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzNhOTQzM2YtZjc1ZC00ODExLTgzODAtNmQyNDI1MjhiMjg3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzNhOTQzM2YtZjc1ZC00ODExLTgzODAtNmQyNDI1MjhiMjg3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Follow the lives of the most elite unit of Navy SEALs as they train, plan and execute the most dangerous missions our country can ask of them."</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Tuđinka
programme.desc: Claire Randall, udana medicinska sestra koja radi u vojsci 1945. godine, vrati se kroz vrijeme na misteriozan način u 1743., u neki čudan svijet u kojem joj je život u opasnosti. Claire Randall, udana medicinska sestra koja radi u vojsci 1945. godine, vrati se kroz vrijeme na misteriozan način u 1743., u neki čudan svijet u kojem joj je život u opasnosti. Kada je primorana da se uda za Jamiea, kavalira i romantičnog škotskog ratnika, počinje se razbuktavati strast koja lomi Claireino srce između dva potpuno različita čovjeka i dva potpuno različita života.

programme.title: Ultraviolet
programme.desc: Serija pod nazivom "Ultraviolet" prati život tridesetogodišnje Ole Serafin koja napušta grad u kojem živi u supruga kako bi se vratila u rodni grad gdje je svjedočila sumnjivom događaju... Kriminalistička, televizijska serija pod nazivom "Ultraviolet" donosi priču o tridesetogodišnjoj ženi Oli Serafin koja se iz Londona treba vratiti u svoj rodni grad Łódź. Jedne večeri, svjedoči jednom sumnjivom događaju koji izgleda kao pokušaj samoubojstva. Pokušava pronaći pomoć preko interneta prilikom čega nailazi na skupinu detektiva amatera koji se bave slučajevima koje policija ne rješava.

programme.title: Novak
programme.desc: Oglašava se alarm upozorenja da je Los Angeles na udaru raketa. Časnici se suočavaju s nadolazećim napadom, no bave se i svojim osobnim problemima: Nolan je na sudskom ročištu, a kasnije s Russo i... Oglašava se alarm upozorenja da je Los Angeles na udaru raketa. Časnici se suočavaju s nadolazećim napadom, no bave se i svojim osobnim problemima: Nolan je na sudskom ročištu, a kasnije s Russo i Eversom pomaže smiriti ljude tijekom prijetnje. Svi se skrivaju u skloništu, a Nolan i Russo pomažu zaustaviti dvojicu zatvorenika u pokušaju bijega. Harper odlazi po kćer u školu, Bradford i Chen pomažu vlasniku trgovine da zaustavi pljačkaše, dok Lopez i West spašavaju nekoliko ljudi spremnih za skok sa zgrade.

programme.title: Novak
programme.desc: Odnos Nolana i Russo komplicira se nakon njezine vijesti. U bolnici na tečaju za trudnice Nolan pomaže Grace smiriti dečka jedne od žena. Lopez privremeno odlazi iz policije nakon što je Evers izboden... Odnos Nolana i Russo komplicira se nakon njezine vijesti. U bolnici na tečaju za trudnice Nolan pomaže Grace smiriti dečka jedne od žena. Lopez privremeno odlazi iz policije nakon što je Evers izboden nožem u skloništu. Zapošljava se u privatnom osiguranju jednog uglednog poslovnog čovjeka. Policajci Bradford i West pomažu juniorskom ragbijaškom klubu The Watts Ramsu kao treneri voloneteri te spašavaju majku jedne od zvijezda tima iz ruku naoružanih otmičara.

programme.title: Novak
programme.desc: Nolan rođendan provodi čuvajući mjesto zločina u odvjetničkom uredu, gdje upozna Ellroya Bassa, profesionalnog čistača. Neočekivano, njih dvojica imaju goste - kriminalace koji su se vratili na mjesto... Nolan rođendan provodi čuvajući mjesto zločina u odvjetničkom uredu, gdje upozna Ellroya Bassa, profesionalnog čistača. Neočekivano, njih dvojica imaju goste - kriminalace koji su se vratili na mjesto događaja tražeći skrivenu zalihu novca. U međuvremenu, policajac Bradford nađe se u prometnoj nesreći kada sa straženjem dijelom vozila udari ženu. Izložen nepoznatoj supstanci tijekom zastoja u prometu, West se počine ponašati kao da je na drogama. Narednik Gray također je u ophodnji s policajkom Harper nakon što ona zatraži ranu godišnju procjenu kako bi joj se povećale šanse da dobije skrbništvo nad kćeri. Gray promatra njezino suosjećanje u ophođenju s gotovo pijanim vozačem koji je bio u depresiji nakon dijagnoze raka.

programme.title: Ultraviolet
programme.desc: Serija pod nazivom "Ultraviolet" prati život tridesetogodišnje Ole Serafin koja napušta grad u kojem živi u supruga kako bi se vratila u rodni grad gdje je svjedočila sumnjivom događaju... Kriminalistička, televizijska serija pod nazivom "Ultraviolet" donosi priču o tridesetogodišnjoj ženi Oli Serafin koja se iz Londona treba vratiti u svoj rodni grad Łódź. Jedne večeri, svjedoči jednom sumnjivom događaju koji izgleda kao pokušaj samoubojstva. Pokušava pronaći pomoć preko interneta prilikom čega nailazi na skupinu detektiva amatera koji se bave slučajevima koje policija ne rješava.

programme.title: Vidovnjak
programme.desc: Drama o životu mađioničara Charlieja Haverforda (Jeffrey Donovan). Njegova je karijera propala, stoga počinje raditi kao vidovnjak, međutim, obični je prevarant. Drama o životu mađioničara Charlieja Haverforda (Jeffrey Donovan). Njegova je karijera propala, stoga počinje raditi kao vidovnjak, međutim, obični je prevarant. Ali, nakon nekog vremena, počinje imati stvarne vizije.

programme.title: Novak
programme.desc: Nolan pokušava pomoći prethodnom vlasniku svoje kuće da se opet poveže sa svojom obitelji, no situacija se mijenja kada neki muškarac provali u kuću usred noći. U međuvremenu, časnica Harper napokon... Nolan pokušava pomoći prethodnom vlasniku svoje kuće da se opet poveže sa svojom obitelji, no situacija se mijenja kada neki muškarac provali u kuću usred noći. U međuvremenu, časnica Harper napokon se može družiti sa svojom kćerkom, a Nolan mora raditi u tajnosti kako bi spasio Harperin život. Bradford i Chen istražuju ubojstvo kada je pronađen izgubljeni pas prekriven krvlju. Wesley postaje dječji odvjetnik, ali se bori s PTSP-om nakon što ga je dječak izbo nožem. Lopez i West pomažu zvijezdama policijske drame pokazujući im pravilnu policijsku proceduru.

credits.actor: Michael Douglas, Greg Davis Jr., Evan Rachel Wood, Gerald Emerick, Allisyn Ashley Arm, Willis Burks, Annie O'Donnell, Willis Burks II

programme.title: Le concert
Koncert
programme.desc:
Le concert: Directed by Radu Mihaileanu. With Aleksey Guskov, Dmitriy Nazarov, Mélanie Laurent, François Berléand. Thirty years ago Bolshoi Orchestra conductor Andreï Filipov was fired for hiring Jewish musicians. Now a lowly janitor, an opportunity arises to gather his old musicians to go and pose as the official Buolshoi orchestra in Paris." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1320082/","name":"Le concert","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTMwNDc5MzYtYjYxMy00OGE5LWI3YmQtN2RmZDU2ZWNhMjFhL2ltYWdlL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjM5Mjc1MDQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"Thirty years ago Bolshoi Orchestra conductor Andreï Filipov was fired for hiring Jewish musicians. Now a lowly janitor, an opportunity arises to gather his old musicians to go and pose as the official Buolshoi orchestra in Paris.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1320082/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"claudio_carvalho"},"dateCreated":"2011-05-31","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Film not only for Movie Lovers, but Mainly for Music Lovers","reviewBody":"In Moscow, the former conductor of the Bolshoi Orchestra Andrey Simonovich Filipov (Alexeï Guskov) is presently the janitor of the theater. Andrey felt in disgrace with the Communist Party thirty years ago for protecting the Jewish musicians and was no longer allowed to conduct an orchestra. One night, Andrey reads a just-received fax while cleaning the office of the Bolshoi's director Leonid Vinichenko (Valentin Teodosiu) and he hides the document. He learns that the Châtelet Theater in Paris has just invited the Bolshoi Orchestra to perform a concert in Paris within two weeks. Andrey shows the fax to his friend and musician Aleksandr 'Sasha' Abramovich Grosman (Dimitri Nazarov) that drives an ambulance and he decides to reunite fifty-five former musicians of Bolshoi to travel to Paris and perform The Violin Concerto in D major, Op. 35, by Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky. He invites the Communist leader and former KGB Ivan Gavrilov (Valeri Barinov) to manage the orchestra and he requests the solo of the prominent musician Anne- Marie Jacquet (Mélanie Laurent) and to stay in Paris for three days. 

When they arrive in Paris, Andrey meets Anne-Marie while the musicians wander in the city, partying and raising money. The unprofessionalism of the Russian musicians forces Anne-Marie to call off the concert; but Sasha convinces her to come to the theater. Meanwhile Andrey grieves the incident with the violinist Lea thirty years ago and hides a secret from Anne-Marie. What is the connection between Andrey and Anne-Marie?

"Le Concert" is a film not only for movie lovers, but mainly for music lovers. This dramatic comedy tells an adorable bitter-sweet story about losses and second chance in life through music, or better, the wonderful and awesome Tchaikovsky's Violin Concerto. 

The director Radu Mihaileanu, from "Train de Vie", once again plays with tragic situations, using a witty screenplay with charismatic characters and making laugh and cry out of joy. I have seen the sequence of the concert at least eight consecutive times, full of emotion and with tears in my eyes. This is one of the most beautiful and touching climax I have ever seen in a film.

The cast is fantastic and Mélanie Laurent is awesome, giving credibility to her violin solo during the presentation. Last but not the least, this film should have been at least nominated to the Oscar. My vote is ten.

Title (Brazil): "O Concerto" ("The Concert" – not available on DVD or Blu-Ray)

Now a janitor at the Bolshoi, AndreÃ¯ intercepts a fax that inspires him to reform his orchestra for a surprise appearance at the Pleyel in Paris."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0348888/","name":"Aleksey Guskov"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0491259/","name":"Mélanie Laurent"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0623373/","name":"Dmitriy Nazarov"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0586123/","name":"Radu Mihaileanu"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0125565/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0044413/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0044140/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0586123/","name":"Radu Mihaileanu"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0086912/","name":"Alain-Michel Blanc"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0730422/","name":"Matthew Robbins"}],"duration":"PT1H59M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.review: --- Actors: Aleksey Guskov (role=Andrey Simonovich Filipov), Dmitriy Nazarov (role=Aleksandr 'Sasha' Abramovich Grosman), Mélanie Laurent (role=Anne-Marie Jacquet /), François Berléand (role=Olivier Morne Duplessis), Miou-Miou (role=Guylène de La Rivière), Valeriy Barinov (role=Ivan Gavrilov), Lionel Abelanski (role=Jean-Paul Carrère), Laurent Bateau (role=Bertrand), Vlad Ivanov (role=Pyotr Tretyakin), Anna Kamenkova (role=Irina Filipova), Roger Dumas (role=Momo), Anghel Gheorghe (role=Vassili)

IMDb data; ttnr: 1320082, Title: Le concert, --- Description: Le concert: Directed by Radu Mihaileanu. With Aleksey Guskov, Dmitriy Nazarov, Mélanie Laurent, François Berléand. Thirty years ago Bolshoi Orchestra conductor Andreï Filipov was fired for hiring Jewish musicians. Now a lowly janitor, an opportunity arises to gather his old musicians to go and pose as the official Buolshoi orchestra in Paris." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1320082/","name":"Le concert","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTMwNDc5MzYtYjYxMy00OGE5LWI3YmQtN2RmZDU2ZWNhMjFhL2ltYWdlL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjM5Mjc1MDQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"Thirty years ago Bolshoi Orchestra conductor Andreï Filipov was fired for hiring Jewish musicians. Now a lowly janitor, an opportunity arises to gather his old musicians to go and pose as the official Buolshoi orchestra in Paris.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1320082/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"claudio_carvalho","dateCreated":"2011-05-31","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Film not only for Movie Lovers, but Mainly for Music Lovers","reviewBody":"In Moscow, the former conductor of the Bolshoi Orchestra Andrey Simonovich Filipov (Alexeï Guskov) is presently the janitor of the theater. Andrey felt in disgrace with the Communist Party thirty years ago for protecting the Jewish musicians and was no longer allowed to conduct an orchestra. One night, Andrey reads a just-received fax while cleaning the office of the Bolshoi's director Leonid Vinichenko (Valentin Teodosiu) and he hides the document. He learns that the Châtelet Theater in Paris has just invited the Bolshoi Orchestra to perform a concert in Paris within two weeks. Andrey shows the fax to his friend and musician Aleksandr 'Sasha' Abramovich Grosman (Dimitri Nazarov) that drives an ambulance and he decides to reunite fifty-five former musicians of Bolshoi to travel to Paris and perform The Violin Concerto in D major, Op. 35, by Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky. He invites the Communist leader and former KGB Ivan Gavrilov (Valeri Barinov) to manage the orchestra and he requests the solo of the prominent musician Anne- Marie Jacquet (Mélanie Laurent) and to stay in Paris for three days. 

When they arrive in Paris, Andrey meets Anne-Marie while the musicians wander in the city, partying and raising money. The unprofessionalism of the Russian musicians forces Anne-Marie to call off the concert; but Sasha convinces her to come to the theater. Meanwhile Andrey grieves the incident with the violinist Lea thirty years ago and hides a secret from Anne-Marie. What is the connection between Andrey and Anne-Marie?

"Le Concert" is a film not only for movie lovers, but mainly for music lovers. This dramatic comedy tells an adorable bitter-sweet story about losses and second chance in life through music, or better, the wonderful and awesome Tchaikovsky's Violin Concerto. 

The director Radu Mihaileanu, from "Train de Vie", once again plays with tragic situations, using a witty screenplay with charismatic characters and making laugh and cry out of joy. I have seen the sequence of the concert at least eight consecutive times, full of emotion and with tears in my eyes. This is one of the most beautiful and touching climax I have ever seen in a film.

The cast is fantastic and Mélanie Laurent is awesome, giving credibility to her violin solo during the presentation. Last but not the least, this film should have been at least nominated to the Oscar. My vote is ten.

Title (Brazil): "O Concerto" ("The Concert" – not available on DVD or Blu-Ray)

programme.desc: Snitch: Directed by Ric Roman Waugh. With Dwayne Johnson, Barry Pepper, Jon Bernthal, Susan Sarandon. A father goes undercover for the DEA in order to free his son, who was imprisoned after being set up in a drug deal." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0882977/","name":"Snitch","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTM4MTYzNjA3Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzcyNDA5OA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A father goes undercover for the DEA in order to free his son, who was imprisoned after being set up in a drug deal.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0882977/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Gordon-11"},"dateCreated":"2013-06-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"A tale of selfless love","reviewBody":"This film is about a construction company owner who is forced to make a choice when his son got involved in a drug deal.\n\nI thought that the film would be an action packed thriller, as The Rock usually stars in these films. "Snitch" turns out to be an ordinary father who fights for his son's freedom, as there is a law that encourages drug dealers to frame other people to get their sentences reduced. I very much respect the fathers love for his son, that he would do anything to get the son's sentence reduced. He had to cross many lives, deal with international drug barons and risk his life, and that is a moving plot. Though there is not much adrenaline pumping action, this selfless love more than makes up for it. Who would have thought that a seemingly ultra masculine action film would have such a moving element?"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":85771,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2013-02-22","keywords":"drug cartel,prison,teenage prisoner,female district attorney,family relationships","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"U.S. Version #1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1168877337","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjAzNjIzODEzMF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODI2Mzc3OA@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjAzNjIzODEzMF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODI2Mzc3OA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A father goes undercover for the DEA in order to free his son who was imprisoned after being set up in drug deal. programme.title: The Devil's Double
Đavolji dvojnik
programme.desc:
The Devil's Double: Directed by Lee Tamahori. With Dominic Cooper, Ludivine Sagnier, Raad Rawi, Philip Quast. A chilling vision of the house of Saddam. The world of Hussein comes to life through the eyes of the man who was given a choice; either be the double for Saddam's sadistic son, or die." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1270262/","name":"The Devil's Double","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI2MjA3MTQ0N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjc4NDYwNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A chilling vision of the house of Saddam. The world of Hussein comes to life through the eyes of the man who was given a choice; either be the double for Saddam's sadistic son, or die.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1270262/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"netizn"},"dateCreated":"2011-02-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"surprisingly good","reviewBody":"Saw this movie today at Berlinale and was pleasantly surprised that as I walked out of it thought to myself that it's been a really long time since I saw a decent movie like this. Before I looked Uday/Latif up on the internet I had doubts about how close the plot was to reality, turned out to be quite interesting showing that, well everything in the movie has (kind of) happened. Makes it disturbing to know on a different level.

The depiction of Uday's psychotic character throughout the movie seems very real and does not spare or cheat the viewers any disturbing torture/abuse scenes. Some people might dislike this, some maybe even enjoy it.

That being said I liked the overall acting, both main and lesser characters did a good job. And on a side note: i found the movie sets and props were quite awesome.

btw: I can still remember the news of Uday's and Qusai's deaths back in 2003, but that meant little to me at that time. IMDb data; ttnr: 1270262, Title: The Devil's Double, --- Description: The Devil's Double: Directed by Lee Tamahori. With Dominic Cooper, Ludivine Sagnier, Raad Rawi, Philip Quast. A chilling vision of the house of Saddam. The world of Hussein comes to life through the eyes of the man who was given a choice; either be the double for Saddam's sadistic son, or die." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1270262/","name":"The Devil's Double","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI2MjA3MTQ0N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjc4NDYwNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A chilling vision of the house of Saddam. The world of Hussein comes to life through the eyes of the man who was given a choice; either be the double for Saddam's sadistic son, or die.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1270262/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"netizn","dateCreated":"2011-02-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"surprisingly good","reviewBody":"Saw this movie today at Berlinale and was pleasantly surprised that as I walked out of it thought to myself that it's been a really long time since I saw a decent movie like this. Before I looked Uday/Latif up on the internet I had doubts about how close the plot was to reality, turned out to be quite interesting showing that, well everything in the movie has (kind of) happened. Makes it disturbing to know on a different level.

The depiction of Uday's psychotic character throughout the movie seems very real and does not spare or cheat the viewers any disturbing torture/abuse scenes. Some people might dislike this, some maybe even enjoy it.

That being said I liked the overall acting, both main and lesser characters did a good job. And on a side note: i found the movie sets and props were quite awesome.

btw: I can still remember the news of Uday's and Qusai's deaths back in 2003, but that meant little to me at that time. At least now i know.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":61319,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Biography","Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2011-09-08","keywords":"debauchery,rape,psychopath,nudity,stripping","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Devil's Double","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4213939481","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTYzMzk5MTcxOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzA5NjcwNQ@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTYzMzk5MTcxOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzA5NjcwNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Forced to become the body double of Uday Hussein, Latif Ahmed (Cooper) bears witness to daily life under Saddam Hussein's reign, from lavish extravagances to sadistic acts of brutality.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1002641/","name":"Dominic Cooper","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0756203/","name":"Ludivine Sagnier","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0712562/","name":"Raad Rawi"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0848414/","name":"Lee Tamahori"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0106821/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0027006/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0859241/","name":"Michael Thomas","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2205151/","name":"Latif Yahia","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0714460/","name":"Emjay Rechsteiner"],"duration":"PT1H49M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Great Raid
Veliki pohod
programme.desc: The Great Raid: Directed by John Dahl. With Benjamin Bratt, James Franco, Robert Mammone, Max Martini. Taking place towards the end of WWII, 500 American Soldiers have been entrapped in a camp for 3 years. Beginning to give up hope they will ever be rescued, a group of Rangers goes on a dangerous mission to try and save them." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0326905/","name":"The Great Raid","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjExMTEzODI3Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjA1NzAzMQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Taking place towards the end of WWII, 500 American Soldiers have been entrapped in a camp for 3 years. Beginning to give up hope they will ever be rescued, a group of Rangers goes on a dangerous mission to try and save them.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0326905/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"BeneCumb"},"dateCreated":"2013-12-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"Decent, but many imitating references to prior related movies","reviewBody":"The main strength of this movie is being based on real events and names. The plot, however, is uneven, with a few intertwined story-lines with unequal weight and smoothness: preparation for liberation, life in POW camp, resistance activities, liberation itself. Following all this, we see many similarities with approaches from e.g. The Bridge on the River Kwai, The Thin Red Line, Pearl Harbor - and without upgrade or distinctive twists... There are some protracted and arid scenes, tensions tend to decrease at times. The cast is even, both no prevailing performances; Marton Csokas as Capt. Redding and Connie Nielsen as Margaret Utinsky seemed most interesting to me.\n\nAll in all, an okay war movie, but no great experience. I would recommend the ones named above instead.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":21758,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Drama","War"],"datePublished":"2006-05-17","keywords":"rescue mission,japanese army,prisoner of war camp,u.s. army,based on true story","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Great Raid","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2547031577","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDczZjkzZTQtNTIyMy00NDUyLWFmMDYtNmQzNGY1NDRmN2E5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDczZjkzZTQtNTIyMy00NDUyLWFmMDYtNmQzNGY1NDRmN2E5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"CT #1"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000973/","name":"Benjamin Bratt"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001212/","name":"Joseph Fiennes"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0290556/","name":"James Franco"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001093/","name":"John Dahl"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022594/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0042119/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0093776/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1220363/","name":"William B. Doušnik
programme.desc: Snitch: Directed by Ric Roman Waugh. With Dwayne Johnson, Barry Pepper, Jon Bernthal, Susan Sarandon. A father goes undercover for the DEA in order to free his son, who was imprisoned after being set up in a drug deal." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0882977/","name":"Snitch","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTM4MTYzNjA3Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzcyNDA5OA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A father goes undercover for the DEA in order to free his son, who was imprisoned after being set up in a drug deal.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0882977/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Gordon-11"},"dateCreated":"2013-06-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"A tale of selfless love","reviewBody":"This film is about a construction company owner who is forced to make a choice when his son got involved in a drug deal.\n\nI thought that the film would be an action packed thriller, as The Rock usually stars in these films. "Snitch" turns out to be an ordinary father who fights for his son's freedom, as there is a law that encourages drug dealers to frame other people to get their sentences reduced. I very much respect the fathers love for his son, that he would do anything to get the son's sentence reduced. He had to cross many lives, deal with international drug barons and risk his life, and that is a moving plot. Though there is not much adrenaline pumping action, this selfless love more than makes up for it. Who would have thought that a seemingly ultra masculine action film would have such a moving element?"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":85771,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2013-02-22","keywords":"drug cartel,prison,teenage prisoner,female district attorney,family relationships","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"U.S. Version #1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1168877337","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjAzNjIzODEzMF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODI2Mzc3OA@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjAzNjIzODEzMF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODI2Mzc3OA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A father goes undercover for the DEA in order to free his son who was imprisoned after being set up in drug deal. "},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0425005/","name":"Dwayne Johnson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000215/","name":"Susan Sarandon"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1256532/","name":"Jon Bernthal"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0006846/","name":"Ric Roman Waugh"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0234935/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0132772/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0251916/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1244808/","name":"Justin Haythe"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0006846/","name":"Ric Roman Waugh"}],"duration":"PT1H52M"}</script><metacontent="
